ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course really helped me nail down my attic prose reading. It made me much more comfortable reading and looking up words in dictionaries. It was a great transition course from grammar to pure reading and review. If you are a bit shakey on your greek after l1 and l2 then this course is the perfect way to feel comfortable reading greek again.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really think the texts chosen need to be reassessed. I understand that Lysias 1 and the story of Gyges are really typical intermediate Greek texts. However, they deal with very difficult subjects relating to the treatment of women in ancient Greece, and in a class focused on the language itself, it is difficult to take the time needed to really discuss the historical background of these works and the problems they present. While there are few ancient Greek texts written by women, and none appropriate for the intermediate level, this does not mean Lysias 1 is the only option. Euripidess Helen is perfectly accessible for intermediate level students, and presents a far more interesting take on women. Of course, being a play, it is poetry, but certainly there are prose options out there which do not involve the same misogamy in Lysias 1 and the Story of Gyges. Classics is in the midst of a reckoning, and I can only urge the department to reconsider whether the texts used at this level need to still be used, considering the problems they present.
I would have liked to move at a faster pace, especially to prepare for more advanced classes.
This course was great this year. A major strength is that it is reading-focused with selected grammar review which really helped me get used to reading attic prose.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I'd 100% recommend this course if you have taken l1 and l2, it is a perfect and low-stress bridge course.
